entry.title: External Python Code Example
entry.summary: A demonstration of including an external Python code file in a reStructuredText document.
entry.content:
Introduction

This document includes an external Python script to test syntax highlighting in Pelican.

Included Python Code

Below is the content of example_code.py:

# example_code.py

def greet(name):
    """
    Simple greeting function.
    """
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

# Calling the function
print(greet("World"))

Conclusion

The code block above, included from an external file, should be syntax-highlighted if Pygments and Pelican are configured correctly.

entry.title: Create a Static Website with Pelican
entry.summary: An introductory post exploring the features and benefits of using Pelican for blogging.
entry.content:
Welcome to Our Pelican Blog!

We are excited to launch our new blog using Pelican, a powerful static site generator that offers simplicity and flexibility for bloggers and developers alike.

Why Pelican?

Pelican is an excellent choice for creating blogs due to its:

  • Ease of Use: Writing content in Markdown or reStructuredText is straightforward and efficient.
  • Flexibility: Customizing themes and adding plugins allows for a unique and tailored blogging experience.
  • Speed: As a static site generator, Pelican creates fast-loading web pages, enhancing the user experience.

Getting Started with Pelican

Getting started with Pelican is easy:

  1. Install Pelican: You can install Pelican using pip: pip install pelican
  2. Create a Project: Initialize your blog with pelican-quickstart
  3. Write Content: Start creating content in Markdown or reStructuredText
  4. Generate Your Site: Run pelican content to build your site
  5. Publish: Deploy your site on a server or platforms like GitHub Pages

Our Journey Ahead

We are thrilled to start this journey and share insights, tutorials, and stories about technology, programming, and more. Stay tuned for our upcoming posts!

--- This post was authored by Dr Saad Laouadi.

entry.title: Introduction to C++ Programming
entry.summary: A brief introduction to C++ programming with a simple example.
entry.content:
Getting Started with C++

C++ is a widely-used programming language that offers a blend of high-level and low-level features. In this post, we'll go through a basic "Hello, World!" program in C++.

Why Learn C++?

C++ is known for its:

  • Performance: It's incredibly efficient and is used in systems where resources are limited or high performance is needed.
  • Control: C++ gives programmers more control over system resources and memory.
  • Object-Oriented Features: C++ supports object-oriented programming, making it a great choice for large-scale applications.

Hello, World! in C++

Here is a simple C++ program that prints "Hello, World!" to the console:

#include <iostream>

int main() {
    std::cout << "Hello, World!" << std::endl;
    return 0;
}

This program includes the <iostream> library, which is used for input and output operations. The main function is the entry point of a C++ program. The line std::cout << "Hello, World!" << std::endl; prints the text to the console.

Conclusion

C++ is a powerful language for developing software that requires high performance and resource management. This simple program is just the beginning of what you can do with C++.

Happy coding!

--- Authored by Dr Saad Laouadi
